intro: Cynanchum nanellum, commonly known as greenbriar, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it is known for its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. Cynanchum nanellum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
